summary: Gothic fiction began with *The Castle of Otranto* (1764) by Horace Walpole, set in a medieval castle. This style of writing is all about creating a scary and mysterious atmosphere. It inspired many authors over the years, like Mary Shelley and Edgar Allan Poe, who used old castles and dark secrets in their stories. This genre has also influenced movies, art, and even fashion, with the goth subculture. Some famous Gothic novels include *Dracula* and *Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde*.
title: Gothic fiction
